sell_stocks.rationale: Downgrade to 'underperform' by BofA with limited upside potential and reduced investor confidence
Potential H-1B visa restrictions creating regulatory uncertainty and significant market value erosion

market_trends: The analysis reveals several key market trends: strong performance in infrastructure and manufacturing sectors (ports, electronics, automotive), positive momentum in financial services with multiple banks showing growth, continued expansion in renewable energy and EV segments, healthcare sector benefiting from industry tailwinds, and regulatory uncertainties affecting some IT and energy companies. Defense and infrastructure companies show particularly strong order books and growth visibility.
strong_opportunities: Strong buy opportunities include Life Insurance Corporation of India (multiple positive catalysts), Bharat Electronics Ltd (significant defense orders), and Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd (strong operational performance and EV expansion). Strong sell opportunities include Tata Consultancy Services Ltd (regulatory risks and market value erosion) and Larsen & Toubro Ltd (broker downgrades and growth concerns).
high_confidence_notes: Companies with high confidence scores (80-100) include Axis Bank, Bank of Baroda, Life Insurance Corporation of India, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd, Punjab National Bank, State Bank of India, Sun Pharmaceutical, Tata Motors, and Vedanta Ltd. These companies show consistent positive or neutral sentiment across multiple news sources, providing more reliable investment signals. Tata Consultancy Services shows high confidence in negative sentiment, warranting caution.
